general

Enum Side

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Side>
      • general.Side
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Side>

    public enum Side
extends java.lang.Enum<Side>
    Represents a side of a Board.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BOTTOM
      The bottom side of a Board, row size-1.
      LEFT
      The left side of a Board, column 0.
      RIGHT
      The right side of a Board, column size-1.
      TOP
      The top side of a Board, row 0.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.List<int[]> allDiagonals
      Holds all of the diagonals moving 1 space in any direction, primarily used for checkers.
      private static java.util.Map<Side,java.util.List<int[]>> diagonals
      Holds a mapping of valid diagonals moving 1 space away from each side, primarily used for checkers.

      • valueOf

        public static Side valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:

      • getSide

        public static Side getSide(int[] pos,
                           int size)
        Gets the side of a Board a point is on.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to check.
        size - The size of the Board.
        Returns:
        the side of a Board pos is on, or null if it is not on a side.

      • getOpposite

        public Side getOpposite()
        Gets the side opposite this one.
        Returns:
        The opposite side to this one:
        • LEFT is opposite RIGHT
        • TOP is opposite BOTTOM
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if by some unholy magic this side is something other than LEFT, RIGHT, TOP, or BOTTOM.
        Hopefully this should never, ever, happen.

      • getDiagonals

        public java.util.List<int[]> getDiagonals(boolean all)
        Gets the diagonals for this side, primarily used for checkers.
        Parameters:
        all - If true, all diagonals are returned.
        Returns:
        The diagonals 1 unit each direction away from this side, or all of the diagonals if all is true.
